metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in Waukesha. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.

advisors.name: Edward Jones - Financial Advisor: Tara L Rotfeld

heroDescription: Waukesha, Wisconsin, is a vibrant city known for its rich history and growing economy.
landscapeDescription: Waukesha's economy is diverse, with strengths in manufacturing, healthcare, and retail. The city benefits from its proximity to Milwaukee, enhancing its economic prospects.
uniqueNeeds: Waukesha requires tailored financial strategies to address its unique economic landscape and demographic shifts.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Waukesha's manufacturing focus poses economic risks; housing market trends suggest potential bubble concerns. Weather-related flooding risks should inform investment strategies.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Waukesha's GDP growth rate is projected at 3.2%, driven by manufacturing and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median household income in Waukesha is approximately $70,000, reflecting a stable economic environment.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Waukesha increasingly specialize in retirement planning and investment management.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Waukesha's cost of living is 5% lower than the national average, making it an attractive place to live.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), Waukesha's real estate market shows a 7% annual appreciation, raising concerns about potential housing bubbles.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Waukesha's business climate is favorable, with incentives for small businesses and startups.
